instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP0V9_SSD_REG: What is PP0V9_SSD_REG? PP0V9_SSD_REG is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD inside newer Macbooks. This must be present for the machineâ€™s SSD to work. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message:
hello this board does not recognize hard drive in disk utility, this measures 


<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD_FIXED</SIGNAL>=0v                          
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD_REG</SIGNAL>=0v                             
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL> : 0v                         
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL>: 0v                            
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL>=0v                            
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL>=3.3V  
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_2V7NAND_LB</SIGNAL>=13.1 

there is no short in any coil  
J9600 good continuity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message:
"J9600 good continuity"
But you didn't mention any signal there.
Are you sure all are good?

Check <CHIP>U9400</CHIP> pins 15, 19, 20 and L9400 voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message:
What I measured was this continuity in this connector if it was bad, but I have not measured any signal.I measure any signal?
pin 15=0v
pin 19=5v
pin 20=5
l9400=0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message: You must check continuity left/right, with the metal plate fixed on J9600.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message: ok,check continuity in  points left/right and they are fine, others are only cpu I could not check these points

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message:
Can you post signals voltage on J9600?
It must be connected, of course.
Use boardview and find points for all its lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message:
estos son algunos que pude medir, otros van solo a cpu, y hay otros que van a unos condensadores debajo de una tapa metalica <CHIP>U8600</CHIP>, esa tapa metalica se puede quitar facilmente?

Pin1= 5.1.       pin2=  5.1
Pin 3= 1.78.    pin 4= 1.78
Pin 5= 0v.       Pin =6 0v
Pin 7=3.3       pin8=3.3v
Pin 11 3.3.      pin 12=3.3
Pin 13=3.3v   pin 14=3.3v
pin 17=0v
pin 19=0v
pin 35=3.3v.     pin 36=3.3v
pin 37=3.3        pin 38=3.3v
pin39=3.3         pin 40=3.3
pin 41=3.3        pin 42=3.3
pin 43=13.1      pin 44=13.1
pin 54=3.3        pin 46=3.3

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message:
Signals look good.
I hope data lines have good conectivity too.

Compare diode mode readings to ground on the lines mentioned in first poost, with good board.

You may have problems with <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>, or some bad resistor on its area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message: I don't have a good board to check:(, I was checking resistors and <RESISTOR>R9350</RESISTOR> on the board has a OL multimeter other times megaohms, and the voltage <SIGNAL>PICCOLO_IUVD</SIGNAL>=1.1v I don't know if it is a normal value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R9350</RESISTOR> is 1.3M resistor, should be good to check it out of board.

Don't need exact same board model.
Any of 00239/281/928 can help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question folder
threads.message: I changed <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>, voltages appeared in all the coils, the equipment entered the system tested several times, I assembled the computer and started and came back with the same problem question folder and voltages no  appear again in coils <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>

threads.message: I did a <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> reflow ensuring good soldering, I got <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> coil voltages again, I assemble the equipment but when I connect the battery flex cable the equipment does not detect a hard disk, I remove the battery flex cable and if it detects a hard disk, it is possible
